artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Ōmiya Kyūjirō; Carver: Katada Chōjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 166.36; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 287.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: seated man wearing black robe with dragon design with red lining; man looks over his PR shoulder into a mirror, which reflects his face as a brown rat's face with black eye; man in turquoise robe with white flowers at right, with both arms up and mouth open, brows furrowed
markings: Carver’s seal: 彫工長治朗 {Horikō Chōjirō} | Censor seal: 卯四改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Beauty and Bravory in the ‘Tales of the Water Margin’ (Biyū suikoden 美勇水滸伝)
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
title: Shumitsu Kanja Yoshitaka
